title: Tokyo Olympiad
creator_credit: Toho Co., Tokyo Olympic Film Association, Kon Ichikawa, Natto Wada, Yoshio Shirasaka, Shuntaro Tanikawa and Taguchi Suketaro
brief_description: This impressionistic portrait of the 1964 Tokyo Summer Olympics pays as much attention to the crowds and workers as it does to the actual competitive events. Highlights include an epic pole-vaulting match between West Germany and America, and the final marathon race through Tokyo’s streets.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

creator_credit_for_label: Toho Co., Tokyo Olympic Film Association, Kon Ichikawa, Natto Wada, Yoshio Shirasaka, Shuntaro Tanikawa and Taguchi Suketaro
description: This impressionistic portrait of the 1964 Tokyo Summer Olympics pays as much attention to the crowds and workers as it does to the actual competitive events. Highlights include an epic pole-vaulting match between West Germany and America, and the final marathon race through Tokyo’s streets. Two athletes are highlighted: Ethiopian marathon runner Abebe Bikila, who receives his second gold medal, and runner Ahamed Isa from Chad, representing a country younger than he is.
